Text.val: -- Variable uses to check the bank account for country "NL"
30.10.2012 GB SCR17642 Removed the 1. Valid ISO code, 2. Valid checkdigit
02.08.2012 GB SCR17483 Removed the Step4 Test Swiftcode
05.07.2012 SH SCR17413 Extended step4 to perform step only if PI.COUNTRY_ID/PI.CURRENCY_CODE <> ''
23.04.2012 GB SCR17274 Changed Germany the swiftcode test in the part Step4 Test Swiftcode
04.04.2011 SH SCR16328 Added specific 'AT' country test
17.03.2011 JH SCR16314 Added check on length IBAN number
16.03.2010 GB SCR15385 Added check for BE Bank account
26.02.2009 GB SCR14451 Added the parameter PI.CURRENCY_CODE
and extended condition for NL
05.06.2007 AK SCR12513 fixed bug in check for ES banks
29.05.2007 AK SCR12513 added check for ES banks
07.02.2007 SH SCR12290 Added '-' (hyphen) to be an allowed character for bank
account numbers
06.12.2006 SH SCR12127 Extended test 1: PI.BANK_ACCOUNT = '0' and
PI.IBAN = blank is not allwed
16.08.2006 AK SCR11727 added task 'Check IBAN - Valid checkdigit'
21.02.2006 SH SCR10472 Added new test that only numeric and alphabetic charaters
and also blank are allowed for PI.BANKACCOUNT
21.12.2005 SH SCR9823 Step2 / NL test --> if lenght of account number > 9
then the last 9 digits of the account number are used for the NL test; also
account number > 10 digits are not allowed now
23.08.2005 SH SCR8890 Added one leading '0' to account number to check, if the
lenght of the account number of the special NL = 8
10.05.2005 SH SCR8257 Added new step 4 (Test on mandatory Swiftcode)
20.12.2004 SH SCR7454 Step1 / Test1 Peplaced PI.COUNTRY<>GNRL_CODE by
GNRL_CODE <> 'DE' or 'CZ' or 'PL' or 'SK'; Step1/Test3 Removed country 'NL' from
20.12.2004 SH SCR7454 Step2 --> Removed test on bankaccount <= 9 for NL
07.12.2004 SH SCR7454 Step 2 -> Bankaccount for NL has to be > 9999999
on 1.7.2004 WJ SCR6525 check the length of IBAN
//08.04.2004 SH SCR5524 Redesigned GB001 to make it more readable
//26.02.2004 SH SCR5584 Removed test of IBAN that blanks have to be at correct
//12.02.2004 SH SCR5493 Extended test that bank account is no longer mandatory
- if PI.IBAN <> '', to all places in the program.
//27.01.2004 SH SCR5284 Added new parameter PO.ERRORTEXT which will be updated
- regarding to the different errors in GB001; Added new validation for PI.IBAN;
- defined parameters as "Select Parameter" and changed the order into a
- more readable structure
//01.12.2003 SH SCR4907 Added update on check param, two new parameter
PI.SWIFTCODE, PI.IBAN
//19-11-2003 BT SCR 4774 add update on chaeck parameter
//08-10-2003 JP SCR #4367 change updates on check param
//23-04-2003 JP SCR #3257 change update behavior for Germany check
05.12.2002 SCR2494 SH If pi.CountryCode = 'DE' the pi.BankAccount (I1234) is
- mandatory and should contain only numeric values (0-9) and also blanks are not
-- allowed
// 01-08-2002 JP add check for German bank id
-- Init output parameters
-- If no error was detected remove text from po.ERRORTEXT
(Maybe it could happened that some text was written to po.ERRORTEXT
although no error was detected, based on historical structure of GB001)
STEP 1 Global test
1. Test (combined test, see below)
... if PI.BANKACCOUNT <> '' then only numeric and alphabetic charaters are
allowed
... not allowed bank account if PI.BANKACCOUNT = '0' and PI.IBAN = blank
-- Bankaccount wrong, included not allowed charaters
2. Test
... if PI.COUNTRY <> DE,CZ/PL/SK and (PI.SWIFTCODE or PI.IBAN <> '')
then PI.BANKID is optinal
-- Bank ID must be entered
3. Test
... if PI.BANKID > 0 and (PI.BANKACCOUNT <> '' or PI.IBAN <> '')
-- Bank ID must be entered
-- Bankaccount must be entered
4. Test
... PI.BANKID is mandatory for countries AT,CA,CH,CZ,DE,FR,GB,IE,US,ZA
PI.BankAccount or PI.IBAN is always mandatory
STEP 2 Tests for special countries
... only if PI.BANKID > 0 and PI.Bankaccount <> ''
... 1. Test for country "NL"
... bank account number > 10 digits not allowed
... Check the bank account only if number of digits >9999999
2. Test for country 'DE'
3. Test for country 'FR'
5. Test for country 'BE'
4. Test for Country 'ES' (AK SCR12513 )
5. Test for country 'AT'
STEP 3 Check IBAN (indepenetly from any country)

ExpSyntax.val: MlsTrans ('Maximum length of BankID in AT is 5')

Text.val: -- Init allowed characters
... numeric
... alpha (upper case)
.. added leading 0 if account number included only 8 digits
.. uses last 9 digits if account number included more than 9 charaters
Mod - 11 - procedure
-- Bankaccount wrong
-- Uses to check the bankaccount
1. Test Check if BankID exists in table BANK_NAME
-- Bank ID wrong
-- BankID must be entered
2. Test Check bankaccount, only if Test 1 = TRUE
... Bankaccount is a mandatory field if PI.IBAN = '' and the max. allowed lenght
is 10 characters
-- Bankaccount must be entered
-- Bankaccount wrong
... Check for valid bank account if <> '' and the max. lenght < 11
-- Only numeric values are allowed
-- Bankaccount wrong
Account number can contain letters
translate letter to digits in account number
update bank account for check
Calculate Check Digit
-- Bankaccount wrong
Translate letter to digits
Fehlerkennzeichen setzen oder Stelle bergehen ?
Active digit
all digits should be numeric
check length
validate bank and branch codes
To validate bank and branch codes, the digits are multiplied by their respective
weights (see SCR) , added up and divided by 11.
The remainder is subtracted from 11
If the remainder of the subtraction should be either 10 or 11
it is agreed that the check digit becomes 1 if the remainder is 10 and 0 if the
remainder is 11.
validate bankaccount
To validate bankaccount , the digits are multiplied
by their respective weights (see SCR) , added up and divided by 11.
The remainder is subtracted from 11
If the remainder of the subtraction should be either 10 or 11
it is agreed that the check digit becomes 1 if the remainder is 10 and 0 if the
remainder is 11.
-- Uses to check the bankaccount
